topics.body:
Well shit.  The rebels in Ukraine are letting investigators into the airplane crash, *BUT* the catch is they're playing dumb about the black box and no one is really in control of the scene and only letting investigators on the scene for short periods of time.

It'll be a outright miracle if they do find the black box cause chances are it's already been stolen.


Also the evidence is pointing towards the plane being shot down by pro-russian forces; also a recording by pro-russian forces talking about the aircraft going down has surfaced as well as video of the crash.  This is going to be a shitstorm.  The missile type in question is not for rookies either; it would take people highly trained military individuals to do so.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"SUCK IT BITCHES!"

So Obama just fucking curb stomped the hell out of the anti-glbt movement.

Basically what Obama is about to sign on monday into executive order is that any and all businesses that do businesses with the usa government can not discriminate against glbt and the kicker is that any business that does business with the usa government can *NOT* apply for religious exemption to this.

The reason why this is so important is that this covers a fifth of the usa's workforce.  In other words Obama is about to sign that a fifth of the nation can no longer discriminate against glbt and they can *NOT* apply for exemption for this.

Also this is 100% legal to do so.  There is no legal doubt about the legality of it either; anyone on the planet that says he can't do it is full of shit.  Anyone you hear saying this "isn't legal" is 100% full of shit.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c99e6d63687254d7300100#post_53c99e6d63687254d7300100
Does it also protect people of any religion, gender, cultures, and sexualities from discrimination?
The last thing we want is a reverse discrimination thing that is so prevalent right now on places like Tumblr, such as heterophobia.
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c9a1ab6368724866230000#post_53c9a1ab6368724866230000
It's been illegal for a long time to discriminate based on religion, sex, nationality and so forth.

What is realistically probably going to happen is how they enforce laws towards criminalizing discrimination based on religion, sex, nationality and such; meaning while it's not 100% enforceable or even 70% if a company is found to be discriminating based on that shit will hit the fan and we're talking huge lawsuits.  If the company you work for is caught discriminating based on race if it goes to court the company's fucked if they're a small company and the person refuses to settle out of court.

That's why you rarely hear any cases around discrimination actually having a ruling on them cause 99% of the time the consequences are so severe that companies will try to settle out of court.  A business would have to be darwin award levels dumb to not settle out of court.  It's not that there's not a lot of lawsuits based on discrimination, rather the overwhelming majority of them are settled out of court.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

It's probably one of the biggest things Obama will be remembered for because there is no wiggle room or exemptions for it; if your company does business with the government and you are caught discriminating against glbt you're fucked.
